result.execSummary:
The defendant Laderle R Williams was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: *Court orders a fine of $150.00 plus all applicable costs, surcharges, fees and assessments; provide a DNA sample if not already done so and pay costs; pay DNA surcharge.  BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO BE APPLIED AND IF BALANCE DUE AND OWING TO BE PAID BY review date of 6-13-2016 or a civil judgment will be entered.
*With credit for 9 days time served. The court STAYED the sentence pending a review on 6-13-2016 at 8:15am.
*Defendant is to perform 40 hours of community service at a non-profit, charitable organization and provide written proof to the court.

*Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Laderle R Williams

records.addlTxt: Defendant Laderle R Williams in court with attorney Robert E Webb.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant has provided proof of community service hours and cash bail has been applied to fine and costs.  The court finds that the defendant has satisfied the sentence and will permanently STAY the House of Correction sentence.  THe court also directs that any cash bail still on deposit be returned to surety.
for Return of Property

Defendant Laderle R Williams in court.   Assistant City Attorney Calvin  Fermin appeared for the City of Milwaukee.  Petition for return of property proceeded.  Proof of ownership of bracelet is provided to the City; City has no objection to return of property.  Court will grant the petition.   Order signed by the court and given given to petitioner.
Bail Refund Packets

2/26/16 bail refund notice mailed to surety.

Defendant Laderle R Williams in court with attorney Robert E Webb.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements to the court by state, defense and defendant.
he Court ordered the Defendant to serve 9 months in the House of Correction, wiith credit for 9 days time served.  The court STAYED the sentence pending a review on 6-13-2016 at 8:15am.
Defendant is to perform 40 hours of community service at a non-profit, charitable organization and provide written proof to the court.
Court orders a fine of $150.00 plus all applicable costs, surcharges, fees and assesments; provide a DNA sample if not already done so and pay costs; pay DNA surcharge.  BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO BE APPLIED AND IF BALANCE DUE AND OWING TO BE PAID BY review date of 6-13-2016 or a civil judgment will be entered.
 Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
  Review hearing scheduled for June 13, 2016 at 08:15 am.

Branch 38 is not in session this afternoon.  Clerk contacted the state and defense counsel on 2-19-2016 to advise that a new date would be needed for sentencing.  Defendant Laderle WIlliams appeared with Atty Webb.  ADA Schoepp was given new date of 2-24-2016 at 8:15.
Bail Refund Check Packet
Court ordered cash bail adjusted down to $1,500 (all previously ordered conditions of bail remain).  $1,000 to be assigned to Atty Webb.
Order for Assignment of Bail signed and filed.

Defendant Laderle R Williams in court with attorney Robert E Webb.  Deann Heard for Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  BRANCH 22 FOR BRANCH 25.  
  Case in court for final pre-trial, however parties would like to proceed with a plea hearing instead.  Jury trial date of 01/06/2016 is vacated.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement received and filed.  Case is adjourned for sentencing in Branch 22.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 22, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Branch 25 is in trial and unable to hear this matter. Branch 22 agreed to hear this matter for Branch 25. Parties notified. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Justice Point report received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Defendant's Motion for Assignment of Bail with attached proposed order. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Clerk advised ADA Kimberly Schoepp will be handling this matter for the State. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Per Chief Judge Directive 15-19, case is judicially transferred.
Jury trial at 01-06-2016 09:30 am
Justice Point Pretrial Report, filed.

Defendant Laderle R Williams in court with attorney Robert E Webb.  Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Matter is not ready to proceed to trial today. Court orders jury trial adjourned.  Jury trial scheduled for January 6, 2016 at 09:30 am.
Justice Point Violation Report, filed. Court takes no action.

Parties stipulate to adjourning the trial date.  Court ordered case adjourned for jury trial in Branch 7.  Jury trial scheduled for 09-16-2015 at 09:30 am.    All parties notified as of August 03, 2015 this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35, in room 629 of the courthouse.

Arraignment scheduled for February 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Laderle R Williams in court with attorney Kathryn A Holtz.  Defendant Laderle R Williams in custody.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge McAdams, Branch 7.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.
